Data: Toss: West Indies have won the toss and they will bat first.
McKay to Gayle, no run good length on the off stump and Gayle softly pushes it back to the bowler
McKay to Gayle, 1 run quick single to get off the mark, pushed to the off side in front of point, off the blocks is @henrygayle
McKay to Charles, no run confident push off the front foot towards point, off the middle of the bat
McKay to Charles, 3 runs drifts towards the pads and he pulls on one leg behind square leg, good running, they have time to come back for three

McKay to Gayle, no run Haddin's dropped the Big Fish would you believe this? Gayle gave himself room and came down the track to biff it over the off side, too much room, outside edge and Haddin threw himself to his left and had it covered, popped off th
McKay to Gayle, 1 run stays back and clips it to the on side
Hazlewood to Gayle, no run full and moving away and he doesn't offer a shot
Hazlewood to Gayle, SIX runs take that! Pitched up outside off, stays at the crease, bends down and launches it with ease over long-off

Hazlewood to Gayle, OUT Coulter-Nile pulls off a blinder! This was short and he tried to pull this over mid-on, didn't look in full control, miscued, Coulter-Nile pedalled backwards as quickly as he could, cupped it with his left hand, fell backwards an
Hazlewood to Charles, 1 run fullish on middle and leg and worked it to the on side
Hazlewood to Bravo, 1 run on the pads and flicked to the on side
Hazlewood to Charles, FOUR runs good shot, drifts towards the pads again, good length and pulled along the ground wide of short fine leg
Faulkner to Bravo, no run gets on the front foot and pushes it softly
Faulkner to Bravo, no run
Faulkner to Bravo, FOUR runs clean strike, fullish in length on the off stump and he crisply lofts over mid-on
Faulkner to Bravo, no run comes towards middle and leg and Bravo clips it to the on side
Faulkner to Bravo, no run nearly sneaked through! Drifting on middle and leg and he played down the wrong line, the ball hits his pads and lobs to the keeper
Faulkner to Bravo, 1 run slower ball and he squeezes it off the front foot wide of backward point who dives
Hazlewood to Bravo, 1 run stays beside the line and gently knocks it wide of point
Hazlewood to Charles, 1 run saved a certain boundary! Charles made room to crash that wide of cover and Bailey dived and got a hand to it, excellent fielding
Hazlewood to Bravo, 3 runs touch wide outside off and he gets forward and carves it over extra cover
Hazlewood to Charles, 2 runs good length on the body and clipped in the air over midwicket, deep midwicket picks up
Hazlewood to Charles, no run fishes at one outside the off stump and he's beaten

Hazlewood to Charles, 1 leg bye tries to pull and the ball lobs towards the keeper, Haddin runs forward to catch but the non-striker sets off for the run, Charles has to hurry and Haddin's under-arm throw hits the batsman's stumps
Coulter-Nile to Charles, no run Direct hit needed! This was clipped to short fine leg, sets off, hurries back and the fielder's throw is wide of the stumps
Coulter-Nile to Charles, no run makes room and tries to clear the off side and he misses it
Coulter-Nile to Charles, no run good length on the off stump and he pushes it to cover
Coulter-Nile to Charles, FOUR runs bit streaky! Charles makes room and tries to whack it through the off side but gets an inside edge and the ball goes between his legs and down to fine leg
Coulter-Nile to Charles, FOUR runs good shot! More conventional this time, this was a length ball and he stood at the crease and whipped away wide of short fine leg
Coulter-Nile to Charles, 3 runs good length on the off stump and he pushes it wide of extra cover
Faulkner to Charles, no run
Faulkner to Charles, no run tries to work it away and the ball clips his pads and rolls away
Faulkner to Charles, no run makes room and tries to wham that down the pitch but Faulkner gets his hand to it
Faulkner to Charles, 1 run on the off stump and he works it across the line to square leg
Faulkner to Bravo, no run keeps it nice and straight and he knocks it back to the bowler
Faulkner to Bravo, 1 run steers a slower ball in front of short third man and sets off
Coulter-Nile to Bravo, 1 run goes back at the crease and softly works it towards midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Charles, 1 run he loves the pull, fetches that from the off stump and middles it down to deep square leg
Coulter-Nile to Bravo, 1 run chopped just wide of point and third man picks up
Coulter-Nile to Charles, no run this was the slower and shorter, got on the pull a bit too early and swished at thin air
Coulter-Nile to Charles, SIX runs terrific! Charles moves down the pitch a few paces and whips a length delivery quick and flat over deep midwicket, he middled that well didn't he?
Coulter-Nile to Charles, 1 run works it down to deep square leg for a single
Cutting to Charles, 1 run good length on the body and tucked away towards fine leg
Cutting to Bravo, 2 runs comes round the wicket, drifts on the pads and he works it down to fine leg
Cutting to Bravo, FOUR runs to call that a 'clean' hit wouldn't do justice, pitched up and he lofted that ever so gracefully over extra cover, you couldn't hear the sound of ball striking bat
Cutting to Bravo, 1 run gets forward and across and pushes it to the off side
Cutting to Charles, 1 run stays beside the line and opens the face of the bat and steers it down to third man
Cutting to Bravo, 1 run short and rising on the helmet and he takes it high on the bat, drops it to the off side and sets off
McKay to Bravo, 1 run fetches that from outside the off stump and pulls it along the ground to long-on
McKay to Charles, 2 runs the slower short ball outside off, he pulls it down to square leg
McKay to Charles, FOUR runs puts away a poor delivery, almost a half tracker outside off, hops at the crease and hammers it over extra cover
McKay to Charles, 1 run short delivery on the leg stump and pulled to fine leg
McKay to Bravo, 1 run fuller delivery outside off and driven along the turn to deep cover
McKay to Charles, FOUR runs good improvisation! He knew there was no slip, just opened the face of the bat and dabbed it wide of the keeper and short third man gives up the chase
Cutting to Bravo, 1 leg bye just a touch short down the leg side and knocked to square leg
Cutting to Charles, FOUR runs almost went all the way! He went forward and carved a length ball and it was in the air and looping towards sweeper cover, just wide of the fielder
Cutting to Charles, 1 run punches it down to mid-off
Cutting to Bravo, 1 run drifts on the pads and clipped to fine leg
Cutting to Charles, 2 runs this was a touch short and he controls the pull along the turf down to deep square leg and that's his fifty!
Cutting to Charles, 2 runs slower ball and pulled on one leg down to deep square leg, two fielders in the deep converge
Coulter-Nile to Bravo, FOUR runs fetch that! It was a half volley outside off and waiting to be spanked, made room and played an exquisite cover drive wide of the infield, screeching away

Coulter-Nile to Bravo, 2 runs chance! Bravo makes room to a short delivery and gets a top edge off the forehand, at least two fielders run after it and the ball drops safely a few yards from the extra cover circle
Coulter-Nile to Bravo, 1 wide drifts down the leg side
Coulter-Nile to Bravo, 1 leg bye on the pads and clipped down to fine leg
Coulter-Nile to Charles, FOUR runs streaky! Charles made room to drive that through the off side and got an inside edge wide of short fine leg
Coulter-Nile to Charles, no run
Coulter-Nile to Charles, OUT not much room and he manages to steer it down to third man
Hazlewood to Bravo, 1 run opens the face and steers it down to point
Hazlewood to Pollard, no run skidded through and he tried to work it away, hits his body
Hazlewood to Pollard, 1 run drifts on the pads and worked to the leg side
Hazlewood to Bravo, no run good length on the off stump, cramped for room, he punches it back to the bowler
Hazlewood to Bravo, 1 run Knocked towards short cover for a quick single
Hazlewood to Pollard, 1 leg bye drifts on the pads and he shuffles and works it down to fine leg for a single
Cutting to Pollard, 2 runs chance! Pollard made room and chipped down the track to launch it over the off side, miscued and it just cleared the fielder at long-off

Cutting to Pollard, 1 run, OUT terrible mixup with both at the same end! Pollard plays a strange shot, chipped it in the air and it just fell short of a diving McKay at cover, McKay fired it to the striker's end and both set off for the second, Pollard
Cutting to Bravo, no run gets on the back foot and defends
Cutting to Bravo, 1 run pushes it towards mid-off and sets off
Cutting to Pollard, 2 runs gets on one leg and pulls along the ground down to the leg side for a couple
Cutting to Pollard, FOUR runs smacked! This was just short of a length, picked the length early, swiveled and whacked it over midwicket, terrific bat speed
McKay to Bravo, no run tries to run it square on the off side and it skids through and beats the bat
McKay to Bravo, no run Bravo's not sure of his off stump, comes forward and pokes his bat out, just sneaks past the edge
McKay to Bravo, 3 runs good running! Works it away to the long boundary down to fine leg, work for the fielder and they run quickly
McKay to Pollard, no run beaten! McKay creating some chances, this was sneaks past the edge again
McKay to Pollard, 2 runs close call! Short arm pull and Finch flings himself to his right and fails to hang on, tough chance
McKay to Pollard, FOUR runs this was even better! Pollard seized on a short ball and pulled with force, bisects the gap between two fielders in the deep at deep midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Bravo, no run good length on the off stump and he defends
Coulter-Nile to Bravo, no run another straight one and he can only knock it back to the bowler
Coulter-Nile to Bravo, 1 run fullish outside the off stump and squeezed down to third man
Coulter-Nile to Pollard, 1 run bowls it full outside off and he just about squirts it out
Coulter-Nile to Bravo, 1 run fullish outside off and driven wide of cover
Coulter-Nile to Pollard, 1 run good over, drilled a full delivery down to cover and takes a single
Cutting to Pollard, SIX runs lucky for Pollard! It was short and looking to pull, it was a top edge that cleared the keeper and everyone else and cleared the rope
Cutting to Pollard, no run goes for the big swing and misses
Cutting to Pollard, 1 run tries to work it the on side and the ball lobs to the off side
Cutting to Bravo, 3 runs on the pads and he whips it away forcefully down to deep midwicket
Cutting to Pollard, 1 run makes room to a full delivery and he drills it down to cover
Cutting to Bravo, 2 runs this was short and he made room and gave it a mighty heave over midwicket, didn't time it as well and the ball drops in front of the rope

Faulkner to Pollard, OUT good catch by Marsh! It was a high full toss, Pollard tries to launch it down the ground, top edge and it swirls towards long-on, Marsh keeps his eye on it and catches it falling back, Pollard checks with the umpire if it was a
Faulkner to Bravo, 2 runs full outside the off stump and he jams it down to square third man
Faulkner to Bravo, OUT two for the over! This was drifting on the pads and Bravo shuffled and tried to work it to the on side, moved too much the ball clipped the leg stump
Faulkner to Sammy, 1 run Sammy stays back and knocks it towards midwicket for a quick single
Faulkner to Russell, no run tries to steer it down to third man but misses
Faulkner to Russell, 1 run goes back and pulls on one leg down to deep square leg
Hazlewood to Russell, 2 runs not for the first time a top edge lands safe! Tries to pull, top edge swirls towards fine leg, keeper and fine leg converge and the ball lands between them

Hazlewood to Russell, 2 runs Dropped! Russell's leading a charmed life, another top edge and it was miles in the air over the on side, Finch ran forward from deep midwicket and may have lost that in the lights
Hazlewood to Russell, 1 run full outside off and drilled wide of point
Hazlewood to Sammy, FOUR runs good placement! This was full and wide outside off and drilled firmly down to deep extra cover, Coulter-Nile dives in vain
Hazlewood to Sammy, 1 run swings and gets an outside edge to third man
Hazlewood to Russell, FOUR runs Russell's here to stay! Nuff said, another swing and a miss and the outside edge flies past the keeper
Faulkner to Sammy, SIX runs second tier! Biggest hit so far, he uses the crease and lofts a pitched up delivery and sends it over the second tier at wide long-on, tremendous bat speed
Faulkner to Sammy, 2 runs
Faulkner to Sammy, 1 wide this was too short outside off and he's penalised for the bouncer
Faulkner to Sammy, SIX runs he's biffing em! Length ball on the stumps and he came down the track and swung it several rows over deep midwicket
Faulkner to Sammy, OUT cameo comes to an end! This was pitched up and Sammy was eyeing deep midwicket again, ended up hitting it flat and fast to long-on, sharp catch
Faulkner to Russell, 1 run low full toss outside off and drilled down to long-off
Faulkner to Deonarine, 1 run slower ball outside off and he chopped it wide of the bowler
McKay to Deonarine, FOUR runs that was pretty well placed, it was the slower ball, Deonarine whipped it high in the air and it sailed down to deep square leg
McKay to Deonarine, 1 run slower ball again and he chops it to the off side for a single
McKay to Russell, FOUR runs nearly carried all the way! Russell swings it flat and it dips towards the deep midwicket rope, it landed on the half volley in front of the rope, the umpires check
McKay to Russell, 2 runs length ball and he swings and it clears midwicket
McKay to Russell, FOUR runs this has been Russell's night so far, goes for a wild slog and he gets an outside edge the clears the keeper
McKay to Russell, 2 runs slower ball and Russell biffs that backhand down to deep midwicket, pick up a couple to end the innings
A lot of the West Indians enjoyed the conditions tonight. A few dropped catches. Can Australia's top six finish this off? Join us shortly for the chase.
Target 192 and it's going to be a stiff task for this inexperienced Australian line-up. It was a good batting pitch after all.
Best to Finch, no run this was the bouncer, loopy bouncer rather, Finch swivels to pull but misses
Best to Finch, 2 runs looked a touch streaky at first, pitched up and it invites the lofted drive, just chipped over cover
Best to Finch, no run skids through and hits his pads as he works it to the on side
Best to Finch, 1 run drifts on the body and he shuffles and works it down to fine leg
Best to Marsh, 1 leg bye swings it and it's full and thuds his pads as he tries to work it away, Best appeals but that was missing leg
Best to Finch, 1 run 134.2 kph, seemed quicker than that, he hops at the crease and steers it wide of point
Sammy to Voges, 1 run drifts on the body and he shuffles and works it to the on side
Sammy to Marsh, 1 run goes back at the crease and works it down to short fine leg
Sammy to Voges, 1 run stays at the crease and works it away down to midwicket
Sammy to Marsh, 1 run good length on middle and leg and h swivels and mistimes the pull down to fine leg
Sammy to Voges, 1 run stays on the back foot and he pushes it softly to the off side for a single
Best to Voges, no run drifts it full and on the pads and he tries to whip it away but he fails to clip it away
Best to Voges, FOUR runs this was short, Voges made room and clubs it in front of square over midwicket, clean strike
Best to Voges, 2 runs makes room and scoops a fullish delivery over extra cover, didn't quite time it as well
Best to Voges, 1 run another fast, full delivery and he somehow drags it out to the on side
Best to Marsh, 1 run this was full and quick and on the pads and he mistimes it to the on side
Best to Voges, 1 wide fires this one wide down the leg side
Best to Voges, 1 run slower ball and Voges drops it towards cover and he sets off for a quick single
Sammy to Voges, 2 runs he pulls a length ball over midwicket and Pollard jogs to his left at deep midwicket
Sammy to Voges, 2 runs much better shot, timed better and it goes quickly to Pollard at deep midwicket
Sammy to Voges, SIX runs good shot! This was short outside off he made room and slashed at it and it went in the air and just over Best at third man
Sammy to Voges, 1 run backs away and cuts him down to backward point
Sammy to Marsh, 1 run swivels and pulls and well fielded by Charles at deep square leg
Sammy to Voges, 1 wide drifts down the leg side and wide called
Sammy to Voges, 1 run slower ball on the pads and he works it down to long-on
Narine to Voges, no run full and bashed down the pitch and straight to the stumps at the other end
Narine to Voges, no run spins back in and he makes room and punches it to mid-off
Narine to Voges, 1 run chipped in the air just over Gayle at midwicket, cries of 'catch it'
Narine to Marsh, 1 run this was short and he mistimes the pull down to long-on
Narine to Voges, 3 runs stays back at the crease and makes room and cuts wide of point, three men chase after it! The Amazing race
Narine to Marsh, 1 run stays back and he works it to the on side
Sammy to Marsh, 1 run stays back and tucks it away down to short fine leg
Sammy to Voges, 1 run poor delivery, should have put that away, drifts down the leg side, he makes room and pulls and short fine leg fumbles
Sammy to Marsh, SIX runs goes several rows back! This was short and he swiveled and clubbed it high and long over deep square leg
Sammy to Marsh, 1 run pushes it down to mid-off
Sammy to Voges, 1 run works it away to deep midwicket
Sammy to Marsh, 1 run stays back and chops it down towards point
Russell to Marsh, 1 run bowls it full outside off and he opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
Russell to Voges, no run makes room and thuds it down the track and Russell does well to deflect it away
Russell to Voges, no run makes room and chops it down to point, good restrictive line
Russell to Voges, SIX runs pitched up on middle and leg and he makes room and swings it over deep midwicket, brings up the fifty stand!
Russell to Voges, 1 run makes room and Voges forces it away past the infield, Pollard's there at sweeper cover
Russell to Marsh, 1 run fullish outside off and steered down to deep point
Deonarine to Marsh, 1 run tossed up and he comes forward and drills a half volley down to long-off
Deonarine to Voges, 2 runs comes round the wicket, he makes room and lofts against the turn over cover, Russell mops up
Deonarine to Voges, 2 runs the reverse sweep this time, gets into position quickly and chips it over point
Deonarine to Voges, FOUR runs nicely controlled! Tossed up and Voges comes down the track and lofts it crisply over midwicket
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run overthrow! Voges chops it towards point, Best picks up and throws to the keeper Thomas who fumbles, nobody backing up
Deonarine to Marsh, no run stays back and chops it towards cover point
Bravo to Voges, 1 run comes round the wicket, he makes room and chops it down to cover
Bravo to Marsh, no run over the wicket to the left-hander and he drills it straight to cover
Bravo to Marsh, 1 run drifts on the body and he chips it towards mid-on
Bravo to Voges, 1 run makes a bit of room and cuts him down to deep backward point
Bravo to Marsh, 1 run skids through on the pads and he stays back and works it to the on side
Bravo to Voges, 1 run comes round the wicket, he makes room and bashes it down to long-on, lots of power behind that
Deonarine to Voges, 2 runs chips down the track and he works it down to long-on and it's his fifty! Like Charles, Voges carrying on from the MCG
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run stays back and works it to the on side
Deonarine to Marsh, 1 run goes back at the crease and cuts him to sweeper cover

Deonarine to Voges, OUT there's an appeal for the run-out and this looked quite close! Goes back and chops it down to point, Voges sets off, Best fires a flat throw to Thomas and Marsh is just short of his ground, top stuff from West Indies
Deonarine to Bailey, 2 runs confident way to get off the mark, on his knee and sweeps firmly to deep square leg
Deonarine to Bailey, 1 run stays at the crease, bends and pulls it to deep square leg

Bravo to Bailey, OUT we have another run out here! Slower ball, Bailey tries to work it away but misses, they try to sneak in a bye, Thomas hits the stumps and Voges is well short, it was evident even at normal speed
Bravo to Rohrer, 1 run gets off the mark with a chop wide of backward point
Bravo to Bailey, 2 runs Bailey goes for the loft and he just about manages to clear the fielder, Russell chases at long-off
Bravo to Bailey, FOUR runs goes for the wild slog and some luck goes Bailey's way as the outside edge sails towards third man and rolls to the rope
Bravo to Bailey, FOUR runs nothing streaky about this one! Pitched up and he connects well with the slog, races to deep midwicket
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run stays back at the crease and chops it wide of cover
Narine to Bailey, no run spins back in as he tries to work it away, hits the pads and rolls away
Narine to Bailey, 1 run works it down to deep square leg
Narine to Rohrer, 1 run goes back and steers it to backward point
Narine to Bailey, no run

Narine to Bailey, OUT the captain goes and Australia are losing the plot! Bailey was down on his knee to sweep and he gets a top edge towards short square leg, Deonarine times his dive well and takes the catch
Narine to Haddin, 1 run stays back and clips it to deep square leg
Pollard to Haddin, 1 run slower ball and he works it softly towards the on side and Pollard darts across and cuts it off but can't cut off the single
Pollard to Rohrer, no run slower ball and he drills it back to the bowler
Pollard to Rohrer, 1 run drifts on the pads and he clips it away towards short fine leg
Pollard to Haddin, no run good delivery, slower ball and a tight line, no room to work with and he softly pushes it down the track
Pollard to Haddin, 1 run goes back at the crease and punches a slower delivery to sweeper cover
Pollard to Rohrer, no run this was quicker, shorter and it fizzed past the outside edge and Thomas took it high on the gloves
Deonarine to Haddin, SIX runs they need more of those! Flatter one and Haddin stays at the crease, leans forward and swings it over long-on
Deonarine to Haddin, FOUR runs 6 + 4! Short one from Deonarine, poor ball, Haddin was down on his knee and pounded that over square leg
Deonarine to Haddin, SIX runs add another 6! Could this be the over? Tossed up on middle and leg and he gets on his knee and slogs him clean down to deep midwicket, a few rows back
Deonarine to Haddin, 2 runs no boundary this time so relief for WI, drills it down the ground to long-on
Deonarine to Haddin, 1 run goes back at the crease and pushes it wide of cover
Deonarine to Rohrer, 1 run chops it down to short third man and that ends a very expensive over - 21
Pollard to Rohrer, 1 run on the pads and he whips it away wide of midwicket
Pollard to Haddin, no run the slower bouncer and he makes room and tries to slash it, the ball passes the edge

Pollard to Haddin, OUT Russell takes a very sharp catch and celebrates with the Gangnam Style! It was looped up on the off stump, Haddin made room and bashed it flat, it really rocketed off the bat and Russell was alert at long-off, got across to the r
Pollard to Faulkner, 2 runs stays back and pushes it down to sweeper cover for a couple
Pollard to Faulkner, 1 run
Pollard to Rohrer, SIX runs effortless! This was pitched up on the off stump, looked to push that down the ground and ended up middling it so well that it carried all the way over long-off
Narine to Faulkner, 1 run pushes it to short third man
Narine to Rohrer, no run tries to work it to the on side and he mistimes it
Narine to Rohrer, 2 runs this was short and he goes back and clubs it down to deep midwicket
Narine to Rohrer, 1 run works it just wide of the bowler on the on side
Narine to Faulkner, 1 run drags it short and he swivels and mistimes it wide of short fine leg
Narine to Rohrer, 1 run worked away to the on side and Faulkner set off for the second but was wisely sent back, how many run-outs can they afford?
Pollard to Rohrer, 1 run tucked away behind square on the on side
Pollard to Faulkner, 2 runs slower ball and he pretty much flat-bats it down to long-on

Pollard to Faulkner, OUT Sammy takes it! This was slower and fuller, Faulkner tries to launch it over long-on, it dips towards Sammy who takes it well in front of the rope, starts off the Gangnam but changes his mind
Pollard to Coulter-Nile, no run short ball and it fizzes up and he swings and misses

Pollard to Coulter-Nile, 2 runs Dropped! Could have been three for the over, he swings and gets a huge top edge, miles in the air, Sammy and Dwayne B converge, Bravo messes up, Sammy sees the lighter side to it
Narine to McKay, 1 run fullish on the off stump and clipped away down to long-on
Narine to Coulter-Nile, 1 run flatter delivery and he slogs it away and it's along the ground to deep midwicket
Narine to McKay, 2 runs punches it down the ground to long-on
Narine to McKay, no run makes room to bash that through the off side and he misses
Narine to McKay, no run goes back at the crease and pushes it towards extra cover
Pollard to Coulter-Nile, no run the slower ball and he goes for the slog and misses it completely
Pollard to Coulter-Nile, no run another swing and a miss, good change of pace again
Pollard to Coulter-Nile, no run he swishes at thin air again, this looks like a hopelessly lost cause for Australia
Pollard to Coulter-Nile, no run four consecutive dot balls! Coulter Nile is having a horror game with the bat, slower ball, swings and misses
Pollard to Coulter-Nile, SIX runs connects finally! The length was getting predictable, he stayed back and clubbed it over deep midwicket
Pollard to Coulter-Nile, SIX runs back to back sixes! Funny old over, short and he stays back and connects well again over deep midwicket. If only he connected the first four balls just as well
Best to McKay, 1 run fires that full and he digs it out down to mid-off and sets off, the throw to the keeper was a bit wide
Best to Coulter-Nile, 1 wide this was a really quick bouncer and inches over the helmet, Reiffel calls it a wide
Best to Coulter-Nile, 1 run makes room and gets an under edge to the keeper, they scamper the single
Best to McKay, 2 runs Dropped. shouldn't really matter at this stage, makes room and tries to clear midwicket, Narine runs back and spills it
Best to McKay, 1 bye down the leg side and nearly clips the pads as he tries to clip it away
Best to Coulter-Nile, 1 leg bye moves right across and tries to pull and the ball hits the pads and dribbles away

Best to McKay, no run full toss to end the game, it was quick and towards the pads and McKay made room and failed to connect, eye contact between the batsman and bowler but they shake hands, they're laughing about it now
Victories for both the men and women's West Indies teams today. Twitter will be abuzz surely. Thanks for joining us today. Cheers!
West Indies head back home with something to shout about. It was a tough tour for them. Can't help but state how much they missed Marlon Samuels. Wishing him a speedy recovery from the eye injury.
So much for Coulter-Nile's prediction at the halfway mark...
West Indies won by 27 runs
Player of the match is Kieron Pollard, WI
